text: old rivalries diehard fire ants and
tawny crazy ants
yup that's their name fight over food
such as this dead grasshopper in their
South American homeland and now the two
invasive species have taken their
rivalry to the US but despite being
smaller the tawny crazy ants are getting
the upper hand because they produce an
antidote to the fire ants poisonous
drops of venom researchers in Texas have
discovered that the tawny crazy ants
self-made formic acid over their own
bodies to counteract their rivals toxic
weapon without the formic acid antidote
only half of poisoned tawny crazy ants
survive I'm guessing some ambitious
tonic crazy ant is going to start
selling this homemade remedy on insect
eBay any day now for CNN this is Sarah
Everts
